article_title: IRS Final Regs On ACA Individual Mandate Clarify Exemptions

IRS Final Regs On ACA Individual Mandate Clarify Exemptions

Law360, New York (November 24, 2014, 4:27 PM ET) -- The Internal Revenue Service in final regulations on the Affordable Care Act’s individual mandate to be published Wednesday expanded the circumstances under which a taxpayer can claim an exemption without first obtaining prior certification from the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services.



Taxpayers who do not have minimum essential health care coverage for one or more months during the year are subject to a penalty under tax code section 5000A. To be exempt from the payment, taxpayers generally must secure certification from HHS saying they...
